p: As CP production requires high quality standards, it must be free of any infection, so tests for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis B, hepatitis C, syphilis, human T-cell lymphotropic virus 1 and 2, and Trypanosoma cruzi (if living in an endemic area) should be carried out [ 52, 55]. In this sense, the nucleic acid test for HIV and hepatitis viruses is mandatory to guarantee the safety of recipients [ 56]. Other protocols suggest the inactivation of pathogens with riboflavin or psoralen plus exposure to ultraviolet light to improve safety of CP [ 57].
